notes.text:
Multiple vulnerabilities affect the RUGGEDCOM Operating System (ROS). The common denominator to all vulnerabilities is the leak of confidential information.

Siemens has released new versions for several affected products and recommends to update to the latest versions. Siemens recommends specific countermeasures for products where fixes are not, or not yet available.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: 
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: The use of Siemens Security Advisories is subject to the terms and conditions listed on: https://www.siemens.com/productcert/terms-of-use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

references.summary: SSA-170375: Multiple Vulnerabilities in RUGGEDCOM ROS Before V5.9 - HTML Version
SSA-170375: Multiple Vulnerabilities in RUGGEDCOM ROS Before V5.9 - CSAF Version

document.title: SSA-170375: Multiple Vulnerabilities in RUGGEDCOM ROS Before V5.9

revision_history.summary: Added RUGGEDCOM RSG2100P (32M) and RUGGEDCOM RSG2100PNC (32M) for V4.x and V5.x

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: The web server of the affected devices allow a low privileged user to access hashes and password salts of all system's users, including admin users. An attacker could use the obtained information to brute force the passwords offline.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Disable the webserver if not required on the affected systems. Restrict the access to Port 80/tcp and 443/tcp to trusted IP address only
Update to V4.3.10 or later version
Update to V4.3.10 or later version
Update to V5.9.0 or later version
Update to V5.9.0 or later version

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: The web server of the affected systems leaks the MACSEC key in clear text to a logged in user. An attacker with the credentials of a low privileged user could retrieve the MACSEC key and access (decrypt) the ethernet frames sent by authorized recipients.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Disable the webserver if not required on the affected systems. Restrict the access to Port 80/tcp and 443/tcp to trusted IP address only
Update to V5.9.0 or later version

notes.text: The affected products with IP forwarding enabled wrongly make available certain remote services in non-managed VLANs, even if these services are not intentionally activated. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to create a remote shell to the affected system.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Disable the IP Forwarding if not required on the affected system. Also note, the IP forwarding is disabled by default
Update to V5.9.0 or later version
Update to V5.9.0 or later version

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive System Information to an Unauthorized Control Sphere

notes.text: In some configurations the affected products wrongly enable the Modbus service in non-managed VLANS. Only serial devices are affected by this vulnerability.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Disable the Modbus Server if not required on the affected system. Restrict the access to Port 502/tcp to trusted IP address only. Also note, Modbus is disabled by default
Update to V4.3.10 or later version
Update to V4.3.10 or later version
Update to V5.9.0 or later version
Update to V5.9.0 or later version
